text: We used our monoclonal model of germinal center maturation , CL-01 B cells , to investigate the role of <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human B cell differentiation .

CL-01 cells are IgM+ IgD+ <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + and switch to IgG , IgA , and IgE when exposed to <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Switching is hampered by <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> coengagement , possibly through interference with the <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NF-kappaB - dependent transcriptional activation of downstream C ( H ) genes .
The physiological relevance of this phenomenon is emphasized by similar <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated effects in naive B cells .

Expression of <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by these cells is induced by <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but is inhibited by B cell receptor coengagement and / or exposure to <extra_id_0> IL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IL-12 .

text: Our data suggest that <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> critically regulates the <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated differentiation of non-antigen - selected human B cells .
